DOC.brief_summary: Clinical Performance Stenfilcon vs. Filcon II 3
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Performance Stenfilcon A Versus Filcon II 3
DOC.detailed_description: The objective study compare comfort clinical performance Stenfilcon vs. Filcon II 3 compare subject 's habitual contact lens . The null hypothesis difference clinical performance two set lenses .
DOC.criteria: Subjects must satisfy follow condition prior inclusion study : Based his/her knowledge , must good general health . Be legal age ( 18 year ) old . Be able willing adhere instruction set forth protocol complete specify evaluation . Read , indicate understanding , sign Written Informed Consent ( Appendix 1 ) Require contact lens prescription 0.50 6.00 .75dioptor ( D ) astigmatism eye Achieve visual acuity 6/9 good eye spherical contact lens prescription . An exist soft contact lens wearer modality . Must able wear lens least 6 full day 7 day ; 14 hour per day , assume contraindication . Have normal eye evidence abnormality disease . For purpose study normal eye define one : No amblyopia . No evidence lid abnormality infection ( e.g . entropion , ectropion , chalazia , recurrent stye ) . No clinically significant slit lamp finding ( e.g . infiltrate slit lamp finding great Grade 2 : corneal edema , tarsal abnormality , conjunctival injection ) . No active ocular disease ( e.g . glaucoma , history recurrent corneal erosion , cornea [ infiltrate ] , conjunctiva , lid , intraocular infection inflammation allergic , bacterial , viral etiology . ) No aphakia Any follow render subject ineligible inclusion : Neophytes , worn lens Greater 0.75D refractive astigmatism either eye Presence clinically significant ( grade 3 ) anterior segment abnormality ; inflammation iritis ; infection eye , lid , associate structure . Presence ocular systemic disease need medication might interfere contact lens wear . Slit lamp finding would contraindicate contact lens wear : Pathological dry eye associate finding Pterygium , pinguecula corneal scar within visual axis Neovascularization > 0.75 mm limbus Giant papillary conjunctivitis ( GPC ) Grade 3 Anterior uveitis iritis ( past present ) Seborrheic eczema , seborrheic conjunctivitis History corneal ulcer fungal infection Poor personal hygiene A known history corneal hypoesthesia ( reduced corneal sensitivity ) . Contact lens best correct Snellen visual acuity ( VA ) worse 6/9 Aphakia , Keratoconus highly irregular cornea
